getWords

public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getWords(int count,
                                                        boolean startLorem)
Returns a list of words.

Parameters:
count - the number of words to get
startLorem - whether to start with standard Lorem Ipsum text
Returns:
a list of lorem ipsum words

getSentence

public static java.lang.String getSentence(boolean startLorem)
Returns a randomly generated sentence of lorem ipsum text.
The first word is capitalized, and the sentence ends in either a period, exclamation mark or question mark. Commas are added at random.
Same as getSentence(13, startLorem);

Parameters:
startLorem - whether to start with standard lorem ipsum text or not
Returns:
generated sentence, with punctuation
See Also:
getSentence(int, boolean)

getSentence

public static java.lang.String getSentence(int maxNumWords,
                                           boolean startLorem)
Returns a randomly generated sentence of lorem ipsum text.
The first word is capitalized, and the sentence ends in either a period, exclamation mark or question mark. Commas are added at random.

Parameters:
maxNumWords - the length of the word
startLorem - whether to start with standard lorem ipsum text or not
Returns:
generated sentence, with punctuation

getParagraph

public static java.lang.String getParagraph(boolean startLorem)
Get a paragraph of lorem ipsum text. A paragraph is made of n number of sentences. n is random between 1 and maxSenteces sentences.
This is the same as getParagraph(4, startLorem);

Parameters:
startLorem - whether to start first paragraph with standard lorem ipsum text or not.
Returns:
generated paragraph
See Also:
getParagraph(int, boolean)

getParagraph

public static java.lang.String getParagraph(int maxSentences,
                                            boolean startLorem)
Get a paragraph of lorem ipsum text. A paragraph is made of n number of sentences. n is random between 1 and maxSenteces sentences.

Parameters:
maxSentences - maximum number of sentences to include in paragraph
startLorem - whether to start first paragraph with standard lorem ipsum text or not.
Returns:
generated paragraph

implode

public static java.lang.String implode(java.lang.String[] inputArr,
                                       java.lang.String delimiter)
Implodes an array into a string Similar to PHP implode function

Parameters:
inputArr - the array to implode
delimiter - the delimiter that will be used to merge items in array
Returns:
the imploded string
